briefTitle: Study to Compare Efficacy and Safety of Daptomycin in Elderly Patients With Complicated Skin and Soft Tissue Infections
officialTitle: An Open Label, Multi-center, Randomized, Comparative Phase IIIb Study to Compare Efficacy and Safety of Intravenous (i.v.) Daptomycin With That of Semi-Synthetic Penicillins (SSPs) or Vancomycin in the Treatment of Elderly Patients (Aged ≥ 65 Years) With Complicated Skin and Soft Tissue Infections (cSSTI)
summary: The purpose of this study is to provide data documenting the efficacy of daptomycin in elderly patients aged ≥ 65 years with complicated Skin and Soft Tissue Infections.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Patients With Clinical Success at the Test-Of-Cure (TOC) Visit
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline and 7 to 14 days after end of therapy
